title: Is Myanmar a significant country? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depend. Myanmar’s location is a sensitive issue for the country. It is located in the strategic location between China and India, and economically, dependant on them the most; mainly China, second India. When Britain ruled Burma, it was the richest and most powerful colony only behind Philippines under American rule, in Asia. Then, WWII changed the nature, and British retreat after the WWII signaled Burmese war, a war that they had not solved for more than 70 years. And we have Pakistan, Thailand, the USA and China involved together. After Thailand left, China became the major player there and still. Significant? It used to control the Tenasserim strait and later it had some of the largest empire in SE Asia, but not stable, weak and collapsed aftermath. Ethnic wars? Many. Many against one people. We have Rohingya, Rakhine, Karen, Kachin, Shan, Chin, Mon, etc. This is a country where its future lies on problems and turmoil more than help…
